Description: Painted cedar(?) wood shabti of Pendua with a lappet wig, a carved face with the features traced in black, crossed hands in relief holding two black hoes, the legs inscribed with a central column of black painted hieroglyphs flanked by black lines, the back decorated with a representation of a small black seed-basket hanging from the right shoulder.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
